solution_line_template: If there {gnomes_westerville} gnomes in Westerville woods, the Ravenswood forest has {ravenswood_multiplier}*{gnomes_westerville}=<<{gnomes_westerville}*{ravenswood_multiplier}={gnomes_ravenswood}>>{gnomes_ravenswood} gnomes.

If 40% of gnomes in the Ravenswood forest are taken for use by the owner of the forest, the number of gnomes will reduce by {percentage_taken}*{gnomes_ravenswood}=<<{percentage_taken}*{gnomes_ravenswood}={gnomes_taken}>>{gnomes_taken}
The number of gnomes that will remain is {gnomes_ravenswood}-{gnomes_taken}=<<{gnomes_ravenswood}-{gnomes_taken}={remaining_gnomes}>>{remaining_gnomes}
